abstract: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.
lead_paragraph: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

headline: I Was the Voice-Over for Bin Laden
keywords: ['September 11 (2001)', 'Video Recordings, Downloads and Streaming', 'Audio Recordings, Downloads and Streaming', 'Television']
abstract: In hindsight, this was not something a brown male should’ve volunteered for so enthusiastically.
lead_paragraph: IT’S rare when we find ourselves as the right person in the right place at the right time. More often, it’s an unsatisfying mix of those and other variables: The place is right, the timing is spot on — only you were off.

headline: The Many Faces of Dennis Hastert
keywords: ['Sex Crimes', 'Child Abuse and Neglect', 'United States Politics and Government', 'Homosexuality and Bisexuality']
abstract: Born-again Christian. Public servant. Child molester. He’s a study in the messiness of human nature.
lead_paragraph: FOR a lesson on the riddles of human nature, look no further than Dennis Hastert.

headline: Kim Binsted
abstract: The director of a Mars mission mock-up on bodice-rippers, ice cream bananas and doggie couture.
lead_paragraph: Kim Binsted is the principal investigator on the NASA-sponsored Hi-Seas (Hawaii Space Exploration Analog and Simulation) project, which involves studying people on long-duration mock Mars missions to see how they cope.

headline: Give Us a King!
keywords: ['Presidential Election of 2016', 'Federal-State Relations (US)', 'United States Politics and Government']
abstract: Whether you’re pro-Trump or anti-Trump, everyone wants an imperial president.
lead_paragraph: EVERY era gets the heroic founding father it deserves, and thanks to Lin-Manuel Miranda’s celebrated musical, ours has Alexander Hamilton — the immigrant striver, the political genius, and of course, the closet monarchist.

headline: What Can Stop Kids From Dropping Out
abstract: Simple steps raise the graduation rate, especially among minority students.
lead_paragraph: HILLARY CLINTON and Bernie Sanders have both trumpeted their proposals to expand college access and reduce student debt, but an even bigger problem is going ignored, at least by politicians: college dropouts.

headline: Rescue the Supreme Court From Limbo
keywords: ['Editorials', 'United States Politics and Government', 'Appointments and Executive Changes']
abstract: Senate Republicans are happy to make the entire country wait for justice while they blockade President Obama’s Supreme Court nominee.
lead_paragraph: Eight justices heard oral arguments in the final case of the Supreme Court’s term on Wednesday. When will the court return to full strength?

headline: Why Is American Home Birth So Dangerous?
keywords: ['Midwives and Doulas', 'Pregnancy and Childbirth', 'Hospitals', 'Infant Mortality', 'Law and Legislation', 'Research', 'Nursing and Nurses']
abstract: If women knew the risks, they might not hire these midwives.
lead_paragraph: IS home birth safe? That depends on where you ask the question.

headline: Donald the Dove, Hillary the Hawk
keywords: ['Presidential Election of 2016', 'United States International Relations', 'Women and Girls']
abstract: The Clinton-Trump battle of the sexes is already getting ugly. Hide the children until November.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — IT seems odd, in this era of gender fluidity, that we are headed toward the most stark X versus Y battle since Billie Jean King and Bobby Riggs.

headline: Stop Saying ‘I Feel Like’
abstract: Pretending that every argument you make is just a hunch you have is self-destructive.
lead_paragraph: IN American politics, few forces are more powerful than a voter’s vague intuition. “I support Donald Trump because I feel like he is a doer,” a senior at the University of South Carolina told Cosmopolitan. “Personally, I feel like Bernie Sanders is too idealistic,” a Yale student explained to a reporter in Florida. At a Ted Cruz rally in Wisconsin in April, a Cruz fan declared, “I feel like I can trust that he will keep his promises.”

headline: Voting Gets Harder in Kansas
abstract: Crude political zealotry throttles the rights of tens of thousands of citizens.
lead_paragraph: Excited to participate in the presidential election, more than 22,000 people in Kansas applied to register to vote in a three-week period in February just days before the state presidential caucuses. It was a reassuring display of democracy — except that two-thirds of that group remain officially held “in suspense,” unregistered and unable to vote. This is because they have not met the draconian requirement of the state law, approved by the Republican Legislature, that they provide a passport, birth certificate or naturalization papers.

headline: The Birth of Hack-a-Shaq
abstract: The tactic of off-ball intentional fouls, which the N.B.A. wants to halt because it tends to make games longer and uglier, was devised by Mavericks Coach Don Nelson in 1997.
lead_paragraph: Bubba Wells waited until Dennis Rodman had jogged across the center circle before grabbing him near his shoulders. Rodman tried to wriggle free as play continued around them, and the players grappled for a few seconds before a referee noticed and whistled a foul.

headline: On the Trail: The Week of April 24
abstract: Five states held primaries, and the race moved to Indiana.
lead_paragraph: Five states held primaries, and the race moved to Indiana.

headline: A Warmer, Fuzzier Los Angeles
keywords: ['Transit Systems', 'Roads and Traffic', 'Area Planning and Renewal']
abstract: The city is looking to become more transit-friendly, more communal.
lead_paragraph: Los Angeles — I GOT lost the other day driving on Venice Boulevard. This is a street, a mile south of where I live, that I use to travel east or west. But it has changed of late, like much of Los Angeles.

headline: Inquiry Into Missing Mexican Students Ends on Note of Frustration
keywords: ['Missing Persons', 'Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings', 'Torture', 'Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides', 'Human Rights and Human Rights Violations']
abstract: Foreign investigators and the government battled each other with dueling news conferences in the inquiry’s final week.
lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — It has been a tumultuous final week for the five foreign legal and human rights experts who have spent more than a year examining the case of 43 missing college students.

headline: Antismoking Coalition Gives Big Tobacco a Fight in Indonesia
keywords: ['Smoking and Tobacco', 'ADVERTISING AND MARKETING', 'Grants (Corporate and Foundation)']
abstract: Funding from the Bloomberg Initiative is building local opposition to companies that have eagerly expanded in one of the largest cigarette markets in Asia.
lead_paragraph: JAKARTA, Indonesia — The densely packed houses along Yogyakarta’s Kali Code River went from drab to a riot of reds, blues, yellows and whites.

headline: Padres Count on a Career .200 Hitter to Guide Them to Contention
abstract: The Padres, who have not reached the playoffs in a decade, gave Andy Green his first major league managing job last October.
lead_paragraph: The Mets surged late last season by mercilessly beating bad teams down the stretch. They have done it again this season, sweeping the lowly Atlanta Braves and the Cincinnati Reds heading into the weekend. They will play the Braves again this week, at Citi Field, and then head for San Diego to meet the Padres, another last-place team.

headline: Ultra-Luxury for the 1%
abstract: Readers discuss how certain businesses, like cruise lines, are catering to the superwealthy.
lead_paragraph: Readers discuss how certain businesses, like cruise lines, are catering to the very wealthy.

headline: Ties After Three Periods Send the Fans to Twitter
abstract: ESPN’s John Buccigross created a friendly online game in which hockey enthusiasts guess which player will score the winning goal in overtime.
lead_paragraph: On April 19, 2011, the Los Angeles Kings and the San Jose Sharks were tied at 5-5 in Game 3 of their first-round N.H.L. playoff series when the ESPN broadcaster John Buccigross posted on Twitter, “I got Doughty and Pavelski for my OT winners.”

headline: Battered and Bloodied, the Clippers Are Shown the Door, Again
abstract: Perennially unable to surmount misfortune, Los Angeles, their stars injured, lost the last four games of their series with the Trail Blazers.
lead_paragraph: PORTLAND, Ore. — The story of the Los Angeles Clippers could be told through the misshapen face of Austin Rivers and through the hobbled gait of DeAndre Jordan, who punctuated his playoff experience with X-rays on his right ankle. More injuries. More frustration. It was the only way the Clippers’ season could have ended.

headline: Not You Again! David Price and Yankees Are Familiar Adversaries
abstract: Price, in his first season of a seven-year, $217 million contract with Boston, ranks second to Frank Tanana in the number of starts against New York in the divisional era.
lead_paragraph: When David Price chose to sign with the Boston Red Sox, he secured $217 million in future earnings and at least a few seasons of intense scrutiny from the Boston news media. He also ensured that he would continue to face the Yankees so often that at some point he might start to feel like the star of the movie “Groundhog Day.”

headline: With Separate Styles, Two Defenders Merge as a Force for the Predators
abstract: Shea Weber and Roman Josi, with two different styles, present one very big problem for opponents on the ice.
lead_paragraph: The Nashville Predators’ captain, Shea Weber, has a granite grip, while his defense partner Roman Josi lends an elegant touch with just a hint of firmness. Two very different styles in the postgame handshake line. One very big problem for opponents on the ice.

headline: Rouhani Backers Gain Iran Parliamentary Seats, but Not Majority
abstract: Supporters of President Hassan Rouhani won more seats in parliamentary runoffs, but failing to gain a majority limits their ability for significant reforms.
lead_paragraph: Supporters of President Hassan Rouhani of Iran have won more seats in parliamentary runoff elections, the Iranian state news media reported Saturday, but they failed to win enough of the 68 contested seats to secure a majority, limiting their ability to carry out significant political and social changes.

headline: Letters to the Editor
abstract: Readers sound off on the latest headlines in Sports.
lead_paragraph: Manziel Is Just the Latest Shining Star to Burn Out

headline: In Congo, Wars Are Small and Chaos Is Endless
abstract: Traditional forest dwellers, known for their capacity to cooperate, have become embroiled in and displaced by one of the conflicts that typify the Democratic Republic of Congo as an election crisis looms.
lead_paragraph: NYUNZU, Democratic Republic of Congo — Deep in the forest, miles from any major city, lies an abandoned cotton factory full of the dispossessed.

headline: Pete Wilson of California Backs Ted Cruz and Warns of Donald Trump
abstract: Former Gov. Pete Wilson of California used a surprise appearance before the state’s Republican convention Saturday to endorse Senator Ted Cruz, warning that the nomination of Donald J. Trump could lead to political ruin for the party’s candidates this November.
lead_paragraph: BURLINGAME, Calif. — Former Gov. Pete Wilson of California used a surprise appearance before the state’s Republican convention on Saturday to endorse Senator Ted Cruz, warning that the nomination of Donald J. Trump could lead to political ruin for the party’s candidates this November.

headline: Stellar Work
abstract: This crossword by Joel Fagliano and Byron Walden will have you seeing things.
lead_paragraph: SUNDAY PUZZLE — Stars. That’s what you were missing. But by the time you finish this puzzle by Joel Fagliano and Byron Walden, you’ll be seeing them. I can almost guarantee it.

headline: Kenya Burns Elephant Ivory Worth $105 Million to Defy Poachers
abstract: It was the most ivory ever destroyed at one time, representing 6,000 to 7,000 dead elephants.
lead_paragraph: NAIROBI, Kenya — What do you do when you have more than $100 million worth of ivory sitting around, just collecting dust?

headline: Kenya Building Collapse Kills at Least 10 in Nairobi
abstract: The collapse happened during heavy rains in Nairobi, and rescuers said they were searching for survivors trapped in the rubble.
lead_paragraph: NAIROBI, Kenya — At least 10 people have died after an apartment building collapsed in heavy rains here in the capital, Kenyan officials said on Saturday.

headline: A Year After Earthquake, Nepal’s Recovery Is Just Beginning
keywords: ['Earthquakes', 'Humanitarian Aid', 'Foreign Aid', 'Constitutions', 'Demonstrations, Protests and Riots', 'International Relations', 'Politics and Government']
abstract: The government, hampered by red tape and political turmoil, is unable to take full advantage of $4.1 billion in aid, and some donors are growing restless.
lead_paragraph: SANKHU, Nepal — As the anniversary of Nepal’s devastating earthquake came and went last week, Tilakmananda Bajracharya peered up at the mountainside temple his family has tended for 13 generations, wondering how long it would remain upright.

headline: Lightning Use Fast Start to Even Series Against the Islanders
abstract: The Islanders could not make up an early deficit as Tampa Bay goalie Ben Bishop recovered from a dismal Game 1 performance.
lead_paragraph: TAMPA, Fla. — The Islanders found themselves reliving recent history on Saturday afternoon, losing to the Tampa Bay Lightning, 4-1, and preparing to return home with the series tied at a game apiece — just as, in their first-round series against the Florida Panthers, they had taken the opening game before falling in Game 2.

headline: Michael Bloomberg Says Both Parties Have Demagogues in Presidential Race
abstract: Without mentioning candidates by name, Mr. Bloomberg compared them to divisive figures of the past as he addressed graduates at the University of Michigan.
lead_paragraph: Michael R. Bloomberg, the former mayor of New York, denounced what he called the “demagoguery” in the Republican and Democratic Parties in a commencement speech delivered on Saturday at the University of Michigan.

headline: From Albany to Prison: Ex-Lawmakers on Life Behind Bars
abstract: Coping in isolation. Sleeping when there is no silence. Getting enough protein. As three state lawmakers face sentencing, former politicians who have served offer their advice.
lead_paragraph: Down the hall came Inmate No. 78764-053, a fist of a man diminished by the loss of the $2,500 suit and the $800 shoes he had just been forced to exchange for a jumpsuit, following a guard to his cell.
